item.title: Windows Clipboard Time Machine
item.description:
On Windows, you can view the history of what you've copied to your clipboard by pressing the Windows key plus the V key. You can then recopy anything from that history.

This is a handy feature that I only just learned about.

You might need to enable the feature, though, in Settings > System > Clipboard.

item.title: PowerToys: Batman utility belt for Windows
item.description:
Microsoft PowerToys is a collection of very handy utilities for Windows, where "very handy" means "Grrr why don't these come with Windows by default?".

These are some of my favourite PowerToys:

  • Image Resizer: Via a right click in File Explorer.
  • PowerRename: Easy batch file renaming, again via a right click in File Explorer.
  • Color Picker: Like Digital Colour Meter on MacOS
  • PowerToys Run: app launcher like Spotlight on MacOS

Highly recommended.

item.title: LinkedIn Learning: often free with a library card
item.description:
Hello world!

First tech tip: many public libraries provide access to LinkedIn Learning for free, and some of these libraries can be joined online. For example, in Australia:

  • Victoria: Yarra Plenty Regional Library
  • South Australia: Libraries SA
  • New South Wales: Wollongong City Libraries
  • Queensland: State Library

No such luck, though (as best I can tell), for Tasmania, the ACT and NT.
